data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Mayor Brandon Johnson hugs a supporter outside the Rainbow PUSH Coalition" srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/5c00782/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6684x3751+0+353/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F77%2F52%2Fb2af7d6a46b3bc94d2281f90d2f2%2Fjjreposethurs-260227-48.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/f58eb21/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6684x3751+0+353/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F77%2F52%2Fb2af7d6a46b3bc94d2281f90d2f2%2Fjjreposethurs-260227-48.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/5c00782/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6684x3751+0+353/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F77%2F52%2Fb2af7d6a46b3bc94d2281f90d2f2%2Fjjreposethurs-260227-48.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Mayor Brandon Johnson hugs a supporter outside the Rainbow PUSH Coalition as hundreds of mourners pay their respects to Rev. Jesse Jackson while he lies in repose at his South Side nonprofit, Thursday, Feb. 26, 2026.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Ashlee Rezin/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>Mayor Brandon Johnson said he was moved by the outpouring of support for Jackson, someone he considered a mentor and a friend.</p><p>“It’s joyful, but yet you can see the pain of the loss,” Johnson said. “You also see people inspired. To see lines of the Rainbow Coalition that he fought for, it’s a proud moment for our city.”</p><p>The public viewing is one of several opportunities to pay respects to Jackson. He will lie in repose for a second day on Friday, from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. Additional services will take place Monday in South Carolina and Wednesday in Washington, D.C.</p><p>A “People’s Celebration” will be held March 6 at 10 a.m. at House of Hope in Chicago. Private homegoing services are scheduled for 10 a.m. on March 7 at Rainbow PUSH.</p>
entries.author: Somer Van Benton | WBEZ

entries.title: Horoscope for Friday, February 27, 2026
entries.summary: <h2>Moon alert</h2><p>Avoid shopping (except food and gas) or major decisions after 10 p.m. Chicago time. The moon is in Cancer.</p><h2>Aries (March 21-April 19)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>Take it easy today. Enjoy relaxing at home. You might entertain or do some research. Nevertheless, your home routine might also be interrupted by small appliances breaking down, a minor breakage or someone unexpected showing up at your door. Get dressed.</p><h2>Taurus (April 20-May 20)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>This is a popular day for you. Enjoy schmoozing with siblings, relatives, neighbors and younger friends. This is a good day to share your hopes and dreams for the future with someone to get their feedback. Jot down some goals to keep you focused and on track. Why not?</p><h2>Gemini (May 21-June 20)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>Keep an eye on your money and assets today because you might find something — or you might lose something. Double-check your banking info as well as your credit card transactions. You might impress bosses or authority figures with your moneymaking ideas.</p><h2>Cancer (June 21-July 22)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>With the moon in your sign today, you are powerful. Don't hesitate to ask the universe for a favor because you just might get it. Meanwhile, you might be attracted to someone today who is different or unusual. You'll also be keen to learn new things. Pay attention because plans might change suddenly.</p><h2>Leo (July 23-Aug. 22)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>Something going on behind the scenes might surprise you today. Meanwhile, discussions about shared property, inheritances and jointly held items will go well. On another level, this might be a restless day for you, and you might not know why.</p><h2>Virgo (Aug. 23-Sept. 22)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>A friend might surprise you today, or maybe a member of a group or an organization will do or say something that catches you off guard. Meanwhile, discussions with partners, spouses and close friends will be warm and mutually reassuring. It's all good. You feel industrious, and others are ready to help you.</p><h2>Libra (Sept. 23-Oct. 22)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>People notice you today, which is a good thing because you make a great impression on everyone. However, something unexpected — perhaps a conversation with a boss, parent or even the police — might catch you off guard. Hopefully it's good news. Pet owners should be vigilant about their pets today to avoid accidents.</p><h2>Scorpio (Oct. 23-Nov. 21)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>Travel plans might change today, so be ready for anything. This is also a good day for social outings, fun diversions, sports events, the arts and playful activities with kids. Romance is also promising and surprising. An unexpected invitation might make your day. Alternatively, romantic plans might go awry.</p><h2>Sagittarius (Nov. 22-Dec. 21)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>Keep an eye on banking issues and anything to do with shared property, taxes, debt and inheritances because something unexpected might occur today. A financial benefit or favor might come your way or help your home scene or a family member. Keep your pockets open.</p><h2>Capricorn (Dec. 22-Jan. 19)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>Pay attention to everything you say and do because this is a mildly accident-prone day for you. Fortunately, discussions with others will be warm and friendly. In particular, you will appreciate the beauty of your daily surroundings.</p><h2>Aquarius (Jan. 20-Feb. 18)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>Something unexpected might impact your work routine today. Staff shortages and equipment breakdowns are just some examples. On the upside, a raise or a financial benefit might also occur. (Fingers crossed!) Trust your moneymaking ideas because they might be worth exploring.</p><h2>Pisces (Feb. 19-March 20)</h2><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p>Parents should be extra vigilant today because this is an accident-prone day for your kids. Meanwhile, social occasions and fun outings might be canceled or changed. Ditto for sports events. Double-check details before you attend fun excursions. Romance might also hold some pleasant surprises.</p><h2>If today is your birthday</h2><p>Actress Kate Mara (1983) shares your birthday. You are observant, independent and charismatic. You appear confident and purposeful. This is a fun-loving year for you. Enjoy socializing along with creative outlets. Nurture the happiness and beauty that you have within yourself. Let your guard down, and loosen up a bit. Old friends might rekindle relationships.</p>
entries.author: Georgia Nicols

entries.title: Man charged in fatal Washington Heights shooting
entries.summary: <p>A man was charged in a fatal shooting that took place Tuesday in Washington Heights, according to Chicago police.</p><p>Bobby Martin, 26, faces a charge of first-degree murder, police said.</p><p>Antoine Alexander, 32, was in a parking lot at 9411 S. Ashland Ave., about 3:30 p.m. Tuesday when Martin, who police said Alexander knew, walked up to him and shot him in his abdomen, according to police and the Cook County medical examiner’s office.</p><p>Alexander, of the Auburn Gresham neighborhood, was taken to Advocate Christ Medical Center in Oak Lawn, where he was pronounced dead, according to the medical examiner’s office.</p><p>Martin is due in court Friday.<br></p>
entries.author: Sun-Times Wire

entries.title: Connor Bedard's fire not enough to carry Blackhawks in loss to Predators
entries.summary: <p>NASHVILLE, Tenn. — Publicly, <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/blackhawks" target="_blank" >Blackhawks</a> star Connor Bedard isn't shy about his competitiveness. Privately, his peers say he's even more competitive than he lets on publicly.</p><p>So while Bedard would never admit it, weeks of watching Team Canada’s Olympic run — which fell just short — while he sat around idly surely lit a fire underneath him.</p><p>That fire was obvious Thursday. In fact, it resembled a blazing inferno. On a night when many of his Hawks teammates looked rusty in a 4-2 loss to the Predators, Bedard singlehandedly generated the majority of his team’s offense.</p><p>He ripped his 24th goal off a savvy pass from <b>Ryan Greene</b> in the second period, broke in alone on Predators goalie <b>Justus Annunen</b> a full three additional times and hunted down loose pucks aggressively.</p><p>Seventeen of the Hawks’ 27 scoring chances occurred with Bedard on the ice. He also took faceoffs for the first time since his Dec. 12 shoulder injury, winning seven of 16.</p><p>“That’s the Connor we’ve seen lots of,” coach <b>Jeff Blashill</b> said.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center><div class="Enhancement-item"> <div class="ExternalContent-wrapper" > <div class="TweetUrl"> <blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">CONNOR BEDARD WITH A WICKED SHOT 🏒 <a href="https://t.co/5GyHI1cSdy">pic.twitter.com/5GyHI1cSdy</a></p>— NHL (@NHL) <a href="https://twitter.com/NHL/status/2027205208346927410?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 27, 2026</a></blockquote> <script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script> </div> </div> </div></div><p>However, the Hawks let a 2-1 lead in the third period slip away. Predators veteran <b>Ryan O’Reilly </b>outsmarted Hawks rookie <b>Sam Rinzel</b> to tip in the game-winning goal with 3:15 left.</p><p>Bedard, striking his usual public humble tone, praised Greene and <b>Andre Burakovsky</b> for setting him up for “five or six Grade A” chances.</p><p>“That’s on me to put one more of those in and maybe it’s a different game,” he said.</p><p><b>QB search</b></p><p>The Bears have found their franchise quarterback in <b>Caleb Williams</b>, but the Hawks are still searching for their quarterback on the power play.</p><p>They spread out reps between Rinzel, <b>Artyom Levshunov</b>,<b> Kevin Korchinski</b> and veteran <b>Matt Grzelcyk</b> during the past week of practices. Although Rinzel quarterbacked the top unit Thursday, that job is very much available to claim during the stretch run.</p><p>“We’ve got [defensemen] that have shown they’re capable of being power-play guys,” Blashill said. “We’d like to see one or two guys grab it and show they’re elite at it. There’s a difference there.”</p><p>Levshunov <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/blackhawks/2026/01/30/blackhawks-artyom-levshunov-reset-break-foundational-skills-jeff-blashill" target="_blank" >returned to the lineup</a> Thursday and quarterbacked the second unit. He committed a costly turnover in the first period, but Blashill said he "got better as the game went along."</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center><div class="Enhancement-item"> <div class="ExternalContent-wrapper" > <div class="TweetUrl"> <blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">On the Artyom Levshunov turnover-turned-goal, Blashill said Levshunov probably needed to "eat it" but also put blame on Frank Nazar for not supporting him. <br><br>"We took off up the ice like there was no pressure, but there was actually tons of pressure."<a href="https://t.co/A6EETLzwDx">pic.twitter.com/A6EETLzwDx</a></p>— Ben Pope (@BenPopeCST) <a href="https://twitter.com/BenPopeCST/status/2027235854062629288?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 27, 2026</a></blockquote> <script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script> </div> </div> </div></div><p></p><h3>Entry fees</h3><p>The Hawks also recently practiced a wider variety of power-play zone-entry strategies after their “one drop pass” approach went stale in January. They worked on an entry with two drop passes and another entry with zero, where the initial puck-carrier sneaks into the zone on his own.</p><p>Both new entries were on display during a successful third-period power play. A zero-drop entry by <b>Frank Nazar</b> created one extended zone sequence. A minute later, a two-drop entry back to Bedard created another extended sequence culminating in a <b>Tyler Bertuzzi</b> goal.</p><p>“I like that [two-drop entry] where I can get that much speed and come in,” Bedard said. “I feel pretty confident about it when I have those gaps.”</p><p><b>Extra attacker</b></p><p>The Hawks haven’t practiced six-on-five situations (with the goalie pulled) much this season, but they finally did Monday. They converted a couple times in practice, so it’ll be interesting to see if that makes a difference down the stretch. They’re the only NHL team with zero goals in those situations. They came up empty again Thursday.</p><p><b>Only one</b></p><p>Defenseman <b>Wyatt Kaiser</b> is the Hawks’ lone injured player. He has resumed skating individually as he works his way back from a Feb. 4 knee injury and could return to action next week.<br></p>
entries.author: Ben Pope

entries.title: Bulls pick good night to lose and the right team to lose to in Portland
entries.summary: <p>Coach and front office can’t always be philosophically aligned.</p><p>Thursday was the latest reminder of that.</p><p>In the green corner were executive vice president Arturas Karnisovas and sidekick/general manager Marc Eversley, knowing all too well that Trail Blazers success means Bulls success. The Bulls hold Portland’s lottery-protected first-round pick, but only if the Blazers make the playoffs. Otherwise, it carries over for another year through 2028.</p><p>In the red corner was the coach from Rockville Centre, New York, who continues spending long nights in the office trying to figure out how he can help will this mishmash of a roster to a victory. Billy Donovan doesn’t know any other way.</p><p>Something had to give.</p><p>For the 11th consecutive time, it was Donovan and the roster he has been given.</p><p>As a result of another high-turnover game — 20 in this one — the Bulls (24-36) stumbled to the worst month in franchise history with an 0-11 February, losing 121-112.</p><p>The Bulls got 20 points from Matas Buzelis, but even he wasn’t great on a 6-for-16 shooting night.</p><p>Not that Karnisovas & Co. should have minded much. Portland’s win kept the Blazers in the No. 9 spot for the play-in, still trying to close in on the No. 8 Warriors.</p><p>And while Donovan wasn’t looking to offer a helping hand in that, he also wasn’t oblivious to the entire situation, especially with the prospect of adding a second first-round pick in a loaded class.</p><p>“The discussions I had with them when the trade deadline was finalized was, ‘Nothing has changed, try and get these guys to play to the best of their ability; we know it’s going to be somewhat challenging with seven new players,’ ’’ Donovan said. “Even talking to ownership, it’s been, ‘Hey, go out there and do your very best.’ There has been no indication from ownership or the front office of, ‘Hey, listen, if we finish here, here or here’ or ‘Listen, don’t worry about playing these guys; just play these guys.’ There’s been none of that at all.</p><p>“Philosophically, I get the dynamics once June, whatever date that draft date is, I get how that impacts all of that. It’s not like I’m sitting over there saying, ‘Well, it’s a close game right now, let’s sit Josh [Giddey] and Tre [Jones] and Jalen [Smith].’ There has not been that. And I think if I did do that, they would say, ‘Listen, you need to put the best guys out there.’ ’’</p><p>It’s a nice idea for Donovan to hold on to, but with the pressure the front office is starting to feel, it’s not in its best interests to play the “best guys” at this point. It made sure of that by trading some of the team’s better guys.</p><p>If Donovan needed a reminder of that, it came in the last minutes after a dunk by Leonard Miller cut the deficit to three with 3:37 left. Rather than build off that and continue the rally, the Bulls’ defense fell apart. Donovan’s squad was outscored 13-7 to close the game out.</p><p>It’s the third-longest losing streak in franchise history.</p><p>“We’re not making excuses; we don’t think we’re 11-game-losing-streak bad,” forward Isaac Okoro said. “At this point, we just have to come to the game focused and do the little things right. Blocking out, not turning the ball over, not letting them get second-chance points. Just doing the little things, and we can win games.”</p>
entries.author: Joe Cowley

entries.title: Dear Abby: Girlfriend hits the road amid man's rough stretch
entries.summary: <p><b>DEAR ABBY:</b> I'm a senior male who has been married and divorced twice. For the last eight years, I have been in a relationship with an amazing woman. She has always had some control issues, but because of the love we share, I was able to look past them.</p><p>I've always been the one who paid for everything. I recently had some heart issues and was unable to work my part-time job, so my income was reduced. I was no longer able to continue to do the things she was used to. She recently retired and wants to do more traveling, which, at this time, I can't afford. This has caused friction.</p><p>Two years ago, I put a ring on her finger, which she accepted with reservation, telling me she never wanted to get married or live together. She likes things the way they are. She recently told me she's no longer in love with me the way she had been.</p><p>I don't want to think badly of her, but I think it's because of my health and financial issues. This hurts so bad. For some reason, I still love her and can't move on. I'm a hopeless romantic and a true gentleman. I'm gun-shy about trying again at 70, but I hate being alone and depressed. What do you suggest? — <i>DISILLUSIONED IN NEW JERSEY</i></p><p><b>DEAR DISILLUSIONED:</b> I am sorry you are depressed and hurting. From what you have written, I can only conclude that when you were paying for everything, your ladylove liked the ride she was on. Now that things have changed financially, she has jumped off, so to speak. You may not believe this right now, but you are lucky she has shown her true colors.</p><p>You do not have to stay alone and depressed. You also do not have to participate in relationships that are all give and no take. With this in mind, look for women who are independent and willing to share some of the financial costs of a relationship. You may be surprised to find that there are many out there.</p><p><b>DEAR ABBY:</b> My wealthy uphill neighbor and I share a retaining wall, which has been damaged by her reckless irrigation practices. Since the damage can be seen only from my side, she's not concerned.</p><p>An inspector recommended excavating on her side to allow waterproofing the wall and installing a drainpipe. I wanted to bring in a wall contractor to get an estimate, but she would not allow it. Evidently, she doesn't want any of the plants in her backyard disturbed.</p><p>Two weeks ago, she notified me by certified mail that she would no longer communicate with me. The city says it doesn't get involved in beefs between neighbors. I'm at my wits' end. Any advice? — <i>HOG-TIED IN CALIFORNIA</i></p><p><b>DEAR HOG-TIED:</b> Because water causes erosion, it is only a matter of time before your property is affected by your neighbor's drainage. She may have sent you that certified letter on advice from her lawyer. This is why you now need to engage legal counsel of your own. She's a difficult person, and you need to protect yourself and your property.</p><p><i>Dear Abby is written by Abigail Van Buren, also known as Jeanne Phillips, and was founded by her mother, Pauline Phillips. Contact Dear Abby at www.DearAbby.com or P.O. Box 69440, Los Angeles, CA 90069.</i></p><p>What teens need to know about sex, drugs, AIDS and getting along with peers and parents is in "What Every Teen Should Know." Send your name and mailing address, plus check or money order for $8 (U.S. funds), to: Dear Abby, Teen Booklet, P.O. Box 446, Kings Mills, OH 45034-0446. (Shipping and handling are included in the price.)</p>
entries.author: Abigail Van Buren

entries.title: Lamenting the whitewashing of America's past as Black History Month ends
entries.summary: <p>Since Donald Trump returned to power last year, his administration has been unrelenting in diminishing Black history.</p><p>Among the most egregious examples are deleting the names of prominent African Americans from <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/columnists/2025/03/13/trump-administration-deletes-women-black-men-minorities-from-military-history-tuskegee-ben-jealous" >government websites</a>, pressuring the <a class="Link" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/style/2025/09/04/trump-smithsonian-museum-order-bunch/" target="_blank" >Smithsonian Institution</a> to get rid of exhibits that depict slavery and dismantling a display — now being reinstalled in Philadelphia following a <a class="Link" href="https://apnews.com/article/george-washington-slavery-exhibit-restored-trump-2a32236320f280ba3e647d900c1301b4" target="_blank" >federal judge’s order</a> — featuring the lives of nine people George Washington enslaved.</p><p>Claiming to remove <a class="Link" href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/03/restoring-truth-and-sanity-to-american-history/" target="_blank" >“a corrosive ideology</a>" that it believes undermines American ideals, the administration is actually doing irreparable harm to our shared history. It is erasing the significant contributions of Black people who helped build and shape the nation. Black history is American history. No one can deny African Americans' rich contributions to our art, music, theater, medicine, law, sports, military, food and much more.  In fact, you would be hard pressed to find an area of American life in which Blacks have not had a major impact.</p><p>There can be no denying that slavery was America's original sin. The decades of Jim Crow segregation and discrimination after the Civil War are stains on our body politic as well. </p><p>Yet despite these awful parts of our history, America is a great nation, a beacon of hope to millions all over the world.</p><p>What makes a nation great, however, is the ability to acknowledge its sins and try to make amends. The American story is unique in its message of championing personal freedom and liberty.  While coming up short and never quite attaining these ideals, we keep trying. </p><p>It is only by learning our history, warts and all, can we better understand the present, grasp our shortcomings, capitalize on our collective strengths and move forward as a nation trying to fulfill the promise of America to all our people.</p><p><i>Dominic Calabrese, adjunct professor, Columbia College Chicago</i></p><div class="RichTextSidebarModule Enhancement" data-module data-align-center><a class="AnchorLink" id="module-490000" name="module-490000"></a> <div class="RichTextModule-items RichTextBody"><h3>Give us your take</h3><br>Send letters to the editor to <a class="Link" href="mailto:letters@suntimes.com" target="_blank" >letters@suntimes.com</a>. To be considered for publication, letters must include your full name, your neighborhood or hometown and a phone number for verification purposes. Letters should be a maximum of approximately 375 words.</div> </div><p></p><h3>Embarrassed Bears fans</h3><p>A local sports radio commentator recently asked an interesting question: "What do the <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/bears" target="_blank" >Bears</a> owe you, as a fan?"  After some thought, my response was, "They owe me, as a lifelong fan, not to be embarrassing. That is the bare minimum."</p><p>But they are embarrassing. The magical 2025 season notwithstanding, they have had losing, embarrassing seasons for decades and a never-ending string of "franchise quarterbacks" and new coaches. Now we have the three-year saga in pursuit of a new publicly funded stadium, with its confused pinball-bouncing from Chicago to Arlington Heights, to <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/bears-stadium/2026/02/19/chicago-bears-stadium-hammond-indiana-move" >Indiana</a>, to <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/bears/2026/02/21/chicago-bears-stadium-hammond-indiana-arlington-heights-soldier-field-kevin-warren-thomas-mcdermott-jim-tinaglia-nfl" >Arlington Heights</a>, to who knows where next. It is laughable and embarrassing. This reflects poorly on a great sports town like Chicago. It is embarrassing for Bears fans.</p><p><i>Blaise J. Arena, Des Plaines</i></p><h3>Tariff tune</h3><p>In light of the recent <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/economy/2026/02/20/supreme-court-trump-sweeping-tariffs-john-roberts-economic-agenda" >Supreme Court decision</a> on tariffs, it may be time to organize a few barbershop quartets to commemorate that ruling:</p><p>Where has all the money gone,<br>Long time tariffing<br>Where has all the money gone,<br>Deep pockets, Don?<br>Where has all the money gone,<br>The grift has hid it from everyone<br>Oh, when will we ever learn<br>Oh, when will YOU ever learn?????</p><p><i>Carey Payne, Elk Grove Village</i><br></p>
entries.author: Letters to the Editor

entries.title: Five Illinois congressional seats, Senate seat open in historic election year
entries.summary: <p>Sen. Dick Durbin’s <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/senator-dick-durbin-reelection" >decision last year </a>to end his storied political career set off a seismic shift in Illinois politics that promises to turn over a third of the state’s congressional delegation.</p><p>Durbin wasn’t the only longtime member of Congress to call it quits. <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/2025/07/30/danny-davis-wont-seek-reelection-congress" >U.S. Reps. Danny Davis</a>, <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/2025/05/05/rep-jan-schakowsky-announces-she-wont-seek-re-election-to-congress" >Jan Schakowsky</a> and <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2025/11/03/jesus-chuy-garcia-reelection-dropping-out-chief-of-staff-running" >Jesus “Chuy” Garcia</a> also announced their retirements.</p><p>Some of the outgoing Democrats faced criticism for staying in office too long, with one for boosting an heir apparent. Another ambitious set found an opportunity to launch their long-plotted runs for higher office, leaving six highly coveted seats open in a rare game of political musical chairs.</p><p>It also left Gov. JB Pritzker with the task of finding a new running mate in his bid for a third term, though few doubt that the billionaire governor is thinking ahead to the 2028 presidential election — or is at all worried about which of four Republican governor candidates emerges to face him in November.</p><h3>Political musical chairs</h3><p>U.S. Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi, a prolific fundraiser, immediately propped up a <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/2025/05/07/raja-krishnamoorthi-launches-senate-bid" >Senate campaign</a> some eight months before the March 17 primary, with Lt. Gov. <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/2025/04/23/lt-gov-juliana-stratton-candidacy-us-senate-dick-durbin-seat" >Juliana Stratton </a>jumping into the race for Durbin’s seat within 24 hours of his announcement, followed soon after by <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/2025/05/06/rep-robin-kelly-senate-bid-dick-durbin" >U.S. Rep. Robin Kelly.</a></p><p>That opened the seats in Krishnamoorthi’s 8th Congressional District and Kelly’s 2nd, where ex-Rep. Jesse Jackson Jr. is making a <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2025/10/07/jesse-jackson-jr-congressional-run-2nd-distsrict-jesse-jackson-sr-84th-birthday" >congressional comeback attempt </a>more than a decade after pleading guilty to misusing his campaign funds. He’s among 10 Democratic candidates running in the South Side and south suburban district.</p><p>With Stratton eyeing the Senate, Pritzker turned to a South Side former state representative and deputy governor, Christian Mitchell, to join him on his third straight gubernatorial ticket — which doesn’t have any primary challengers this time around.</p><p>That cinches up a general election showing that could end up as a rematch against the downstate former state senator who was clobbered by Pritzker. <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2025/09/09/darren-bailey-running-for-governor-again-jb-pritzker-aaron-del-mar" >Darren Bailey</a> is running it back in a GOP primary field that also includes conservative commentator Ted Dabrowski, video gambling mogul Rick Heidner and DuPage County Sheriff James Mendrick.</p><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2026/01/30/rick-heidner-republican-candidate-governor-video-gambling-magnate-ballys-casino-d-and-p-construction-rosemont" >Gov hopeful took money from exec of garbage hauler dogged by mob allegations</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>Massive fields jumped out of the gate in the 7th and 9th congressional districts, where Davis and Schakowsky respectively capped careers after almost three decades apiece in Washington. Thirteen Democrats are vying for Davis’ West Side-anchored seat, with 15 seeking Schakowsky’s seat to the north. Schakowsky has endorsed Evanston Mayor Daniel Biss in the race, while Davis is trying to pass the baton to State Rep. LaShawn Ford, D-Chicago.</p><p>There was no wave of candidates clamoring for “Chuy” Garcia’s seat, though, mostly because the longtime Southwest Side congressman didn’t publicly announce he was retiring for health reasons until the end of the candidate filing period last fall. <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2025/11/06/patty-garcia-chief-of-staff-jesus-chuy-garcia-successor-march-primary-congress" >Patty Garcia, </a>the congressman’s chief of staff, is the lone Democrat on the primary ballot. But <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2026/01/28/chuy-garcia-congress-seat-byron-sigcho-lopez-mayra-macias-independent-bids" >two Democrats running as independents, </a>Ald. Byron Sigcho-Lopez and Mayra Macias, are now vying to land a spot on the November ballot.</p><h3>New faces</h3><p>David Hogg, a political activist and former vice chair of the Democratic National Committee, raised eyebrows last year when he said the party must rid itself of a “culture of seniority politics.” That stance divided many Democrats, and Hogg opted to step aside from his position after the party voted to force him to run again.</p><p>Anger aside, his stance resonated with many Democrats, who had grumbled that veteran Illinois lawmakers had lost touch with the party’s growing and changing base.</p><p>The Illinois congressional delegation will look a lot different in 2027, with at least five new members of Congress. U.S. Reps. Mike Quigley, elected in 2009, and Rep. Bill Foster, elected in 2013, likely will become the most senior members of the delegation. Rep. Mike Bost, elected in 2015, is poised to become the most senior member of Illinois’ Republican delegation.</p><h3>Cook County’s heated rivalries</h3><p>Longtime Cook County Board President Toni Preckwinkle is aiming to prevent any turnover in the office she’s held since 2010. She’ll have to fend off an energetic <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2026/02/06/cook-county-board-president-democratic-primary-what-to-know-preckwinkle-reilly" >primary challenge</a> from downtown Ald. Brendan Reilly (42nd), who has criticized the length of her tenure and slammed growing county budgets. Preckwinkle calls him President Donald “Trump’s man in Chicago.”</p><p>The same goes for Cook County Assessor Fritz Kaegi, who is trying to hold on for a third term over opposition from the Preckwinkle-led Cook County Democratic Party, which is endorsing his challenger, Lyons Township Assessor Patrick Hynes.</p>
entries.author: Mitchell Armentrout

entries.title: Highland Park gun control activists keep score on weapon producers and their business partners
entries.summary: <p>You don’t have to look far to find local economic ties to assault rifle manufacturers.</p><p>Sometimes you don’t even have to look outside the cities where life has been upended at the barrel of such weapons.</p><p>Look no farther than Highland Park, home to several attorneys who work at the Chicago office of the global law firm DLA Piper, which is defending Smith & Wesson in a civil lawsuit <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/highland-park-parade-shooting/2025/04/01/highland-park-lawsuit-smith-wesson-guns-crimo" target="_blank" ><u>brought by survivors of the July 4, 2022, shooting</u></a> that left seven dead and dozens wounded in the north suburb.</p><p>“We know a lot of people who work at that firm, who live here in Highland Park, who were at the parade,” said Stephanie Jacobs, who heard the shots fired in her hometown. “The irony and the hypocrisy is just crazy.”</p><p>That’s why Jacobs teamed up with fellow corporate attorney Daniel Perlman on the nonprofit Highland Park Peace Project, compiling a public database of firms and companies with documented ties to weapon manufacturers.</p><p>Also noting businesses that refuse to deal with companies whose products have been used in mass shootings across the United States, Jacobs and Perlman encourage consumers to speak out with their pocketbooks by doing business with “certified heroes” and cutting off the “exposed enablers.”</p><p>They’ve graded more than 180 companies <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/2025/08/12/highland-park-gun-database-peace-project" target="_blank" ><u>since launching last year</u></a>, scouring U.S. Security and Exchange Commission filings and other public records to uncover connections to the gun industry, while adding 60 companies to the list for public shame over the past few months.</p><p>“Finding these things out and putting the data out there, it's really important that people know this and understand,” Jacobs said. “The goal is not to vilify these law firms. The goal is to get them to change what they're doing, to do better, to not enable these companies anymore. That's really what we're trying to do.”</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-8c0000" name="image-8c0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8be9d41/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4240x2380+0+226/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F0d%2F2a%2Ff49f1057417fbb41201248bd4625%2Fhighlandpark-070522-13.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/9005bb1/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4240x2380+0+226/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F0d%2F2a%2Ff49f1057417fbb41201248bd4625%2Fhighlandpark-070522-13.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a8c1086/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4240x2380+0+226/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F0d%2F2a%2Ff49f1057417fbb41201248bd4625%2Fhighlandpark-070522-13.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Empty chairs on the street after a mass shooting at the Highland Park Fourth of July parade in downtown Highland Park. Monday, July 4, 2022. " srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a8c1086/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4240x2380+0+226/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F0d%2F2a%2Ff49f1057417fbb41201248bd4625%2Fhighlandpark-070522-13.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/dce0533/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4240x2380+0+226/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F0d%2F2a%2Ff49f1057417fbb41201248bd4625%2Fhighlandpark-070522-13.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a8c1086/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4240x2380+0+226/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F0d%2F2a%2Ff49f1057417fbb41201248bd4625%2Fhighlandpark-070522-13.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Empty chairs on the street after a mass shooting at the Highland Park Fourth of July parade in downtown Highland Park. Monday, July 4, 2022.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Sun-Times file photo</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>They’ve stumbled across stark examples of business interests colliding with tragedy, including for the global professional services firm KPMG, whose New York City headquarters were locked down during a shooting that killed four people elsewhere in a Manhattan office building <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/nfl/2025/07/29/new-york-gunman-killed-4-nfl-cte" target="_blank" ><u>last summer</u></a>.</p><p>The Highland Park Peace Project revealed KPMG has served as the public auditor for Smith & Wesson, which produces long guns similar to the one used in that attack. Neither company responded to requests for comment.</p><p>“Smith & Wesson’s a tiny little company with like a $300 million market cap. It's not not driving KPMG's business,” Perlman said. “It's remarkable that these CEOs and managing partners don't see the bigger picture here.”</p><p>With enough scrutiny, Jacobs said, “enough people are going to change auditors because of it, and that's going to affect them, and maybe then they'll do the right thing.”</p><p>Looking ahead, Perlman wants to target recruiters who he thinks will have trouble attracting talent in the next generation of corporate leaders. “I think we're going to be very successful in changing minds.”</p><p>While the average consumer isn’t dealing with global accounting firms — or any of the machinery and industrial suppliers flagged in project’s latest tranche of alleged enablers — <a class="Link" href="https://www.hppeaceproject.org/scorecard/" target="_blank" >their website</a> puts more familiar names on blast, too.</p><p>Walmart gets dinged for online weapons sales, along with FedEx and UPS for delivering them. The same goes for major sporting good companies like Bass Pro Shops and Cabela’s, which didn’t respond to requests for comment.</p><p>Walmart, which stopped selling AR-15-style rifles in 2015 and halted sales of ammunition for military-style weapons in 2019, says on its website that "our heritage as a company has always been in serving sportsmen and hunters, and we plan to continue to do so in a responsible way." The company doesn't sell handguns either. </p><p>Also listed as an "enabler" is Amazon, which prohibits firearm sales but carries other products from companies that produce guns. </p><p>Perlman said the Peace Project has gotten muted responses from companies notified that they had landed on the database of “enablers,” with some law firms and businesses privately pleading to be removed and others standing firmly with their clients.</p><p>Endorsed by the nonprofit research group are Costco and REI, which have shunned weapon manufacturers, as well as Apple Pay and PayPal, which don’t allow their platforms to be used for gun or ammunition purchases.</p><p>Jacobs and Perlman rate dozens more companies across the finance, tech and manufacturing industries.</p><p>“People want to do something and people don't know what to do, people at all levels, everyday consumers like you and me as well as high-powered decision makers at corporations,” Jacobs said. “Everyone who cares about this issue, everyone who cares about their children and wants to do something — this is such an easy thing to do.”</p>
entries.author: Mitchell Armentrout

entries.title: Cook County Assessor Fritz Kaegi faces strong challenge from suburban assessor Pat Hynes in bid for 3rd term
entries.summary: <p>Vying for his third term in the office, Cook County Assessor Fritz Kaegi faces a challenge in the March 17 Democratic primary from one of his own — first-term Lyons Township Assessor Patrick Hynes, who spent 23 years working in the assessor’s office as a residential field inspector, including three under Kaegi.</p><p>It comes at a tumultuous time for many Cook County property taxpayers — residential property tax bills are rising fastest in predominantly Black neighborhoods on the South and West sides.</p><p>During the pandemic, Kaegi modified assessments for all homeowners, based on expected unemployment and predicting market values would go down, when they instead went up. </p><p>At the same time, county’s tax burden shifted away from the city’s economic center. Commercial value has been dropping as large businesses and wealthy land owners appeal assessments at higher rates — and more successfully — shifting more of the burden onto low income home owners, according to a November <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/real-estate/2025/11/17/cook-county-property-taxes-analysis-treasurer-maria-pappas-downtown-south-west-sides?utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=11172025%20Morning%20Edition&utm_content=11172025%20Morning%20Edition+CID_06f49f4c104db8c861653fcf9ca001a0&utm_source=cst_campaign_monitor&utm_term=Black%20neighborhoods%20are%20hit%20hardest%20with%20Cook%20County%20property%20tax%20bill%20increase%20Analysis&tpcc=cst_cm" target="_blank" ><u>Cook County treasurer’s office report</u></a> and a Chicago Sun-Times <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2025/03/07/property-taxes-loop-pandemic-christopher-berry-pat-quinn-joseph-schwieterman-joseph-ferguson-farzin-parang?utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=11172025%20Morning%20Edition&utm_content=11172025%20Morning%20Edition+CID_06f49f4c104db8c861653fcf9ca001a0&utm_source=cst_campaign_monitor&utm_term=Sun-Times%20broke%20the%20news&tpcc=cst_cm" target="_blank" ><u>analysis of five years of tax bills</u></a>.</p><p>The combination helped lead to the whiplash affecting homeowners now.</p><p>Kaegi, who has been in office since 2018, said he still stands by his move, and continues to push for circuit breaker legislation as a solution, which would cap individual tax bill increases and create a relief system for low income homeowners, though iterations of the policy have stalled in Springfield. </p><p>“We need to have a property tax relief system,” Kaegi said.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-ac0000" name="image-ac0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/37cfb68/2147483647/strip/true/crop/2382x1337+0+126/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F80%2F1e%2F03ee38884508b58a5a4347612e48%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12.jpg alt="WTKASSESSOR_260206-12.jpg" srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/f70b236/2147483647/strip/true/crop/2382x1337+0+126/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F80%2F1e%2F03ee38884508b58a5a4347612e48%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/451d685/2147483647/strip/true/crop/2382x1337+0+126/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F80%2F1e%2F03ee38884508b58a5a4347612e48%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/f70b236/2147483647/strip/true/crop/2382x1337+0+126/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F80%2F1e%2F03ee38884508b58a5a4347612e48%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Cook County Assessor Fritz Kaegi incumbent for the Democratic primary speaks to a Chicago Sun-Times reporter inside a boardroom of his campaign office in The Loop, Wednesday, Feb. 4, 2026.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Tyler Pasciak LaRiviere/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/news/2026/01/05/south-and-west-side-clergy-call-for-relief-from-sinful-property-tax-spikes" >South and West side clergy seek relief from ‘sinful’ property tax spikes</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>Hynes called it an “unforced error,” blaming many of the office’s woes on Kaegi's COVID-19 adjustment. He said circuit breaker laws would be costly and could be avoided had the assessment stayed on track with market value.</p><p>He admits there are “no magic beans,” but said the office has an "embarrassment of riches” when it comes to tools at its disposal to improve the system. </p><p>“We are causing real harm to people at times when we get it wrong,” Hynes said. “Even in a hot market, we don’t have that kind of wild adjustment in value.”</p><p>Kaegi’s early tenure saw some positive change. Christopher Berry, a professor of public policy at University of Chicago and director of the school’s Mansueto Institute for Urban Innovation, said Kaegi has reduced overassessments for lower value homes and underassessments on higher value homes.</p><p>It was a break from former assessor Joe Berrios, whose assessment methods often favored wealthier property owners and allowed them to pay less in property taxes than those in low-income and minority communities. One of Kaegi’s first moves was adopting a <a class="Link" href="https://prodassets.cookcountyassessoril.gov/s3fs-public/page_comm/ExecutiveOrder.pdf" target="_blank" ><u>new code of ethics</u></a> for the office.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-f70000" name="image-f70000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/9ad141a/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1f%2Fe4%2F7476cc5445eebfab6b0e94c53314%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12-1.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1a8a9b4/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1f%2Fe4%2F7476cc5445eebfab6b0e94c53314%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12-1.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a583d16/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1f%2Fe4%2F7476cc5445eebfab6b0e94c53314%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12-1.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Lyons Township Assessor Pat Hynes speaks about why he is running for Cook County Assessor at IBEW Local 134 at 2722 S. Martin Luther King Dr. in Douglas, Thursday, Feb. 5, 2026." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a583d16/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1f%2Fe4%2F7476cc5445eebfab6b0e94c53314%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12-1.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a583d16/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1f%2Fe4%2F7476cc5445eebfab6b0e94c53314%2Fwtkassessor-260206-12-1.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Lyons Township Assessor Pat Hynes speaks about why he is running for Cook County Assessor at IBEW Local 134 Feb. 5, 2026.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Anthony Vazquez/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://www.wbez.org/politics/2021/02/18/ex-cook-county-assessor-berrios-pays-100-000-to-settle-ethics-case" target="_blank" >Ex-Cook County Assessor Joe Berrios Pays $100,000 To Settle Ethics Case</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/2025/05/27/ex-cook-county-assessors-employee-gets-probation-after-admitting-to-bribery-scheme-helping-feds" >Ex-Cook County assessor’s employee gets probation after admitting to bribery scheme, helping feds</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>But with the whiplash of the COVID-19 adjustments and a county with a greater demand for tax money every year, taxes have continued to rise.</p><p>“The most notable change [under Kaegi] has been more fair taxes,” Berry said. “The decline in downtown office values in particular shifts the tax burden to residential... People are seeing their taxes go up regardless of the fact that the assessments are more fair.”</p><p>Hynes has touted cracking down on properties that have undergone construction that he says the assessor’s office has missed, including properties in his own jurisdiction. He wants to expand field inspector teams and use AI tools on satellite imagery to better identify new construction. </p><p></p><p>“You assess according to the law and the market, it should move at a slow, predictable pace,” Hynes said. “Think of the buildings that weren’t built because they were chased away by an erratic property tax system... If they don’t build it, we can’t tax it, and then we can’t spread that burden around to provide relief for taxpayers.”</p><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2026/how-to-vote-illinois-primary" >How to cast your ballot in the March 2026 Illinois primary</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2026/02/06/what-to-know-democratic-primary-cook-county-assessor-fritz-kaegi-pat-hynes" >What to know about the Democratic primary race for Cook County assessor</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/elections/2026/02/06/cook-county-board-president-democratic-primary-what-to-know-preckwinkle-reilly" >What to know about the Democratic primary for Cook County board president</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>Kaegi has shot back about Hynes taking contributions from property tax lawyers. Campaign finance records show Hynes has taken nearly $70,000 from at least 43 different lawyers employed by firms providing property tax services, or the firms themselves, since Sept. 30.</p><p>That includes nearly $10,000 from lawyers at Worsek and Vihon, a property tax law firm that boasts it led to <a class="Link" href="https://www.wvproptax.com/recent-decisions/#" target="_blank" ><u>recent reductions of more than $3 million</u></a> for several Cook County properties, according to campaign contribution data.</p><p>Kaegi took a $1,032 donation from a lawyer at Kirkland & Ellis, which provides tax dispute services for clients. Lawyers at the firm also donated $7,500 to Hynes.</p><p>Hynes has pointed to the tens of thousands of dollars Kaegi has taken from developers, construction companies and others in the real estate field — including $25,000 from investor Stephen Schuler at Wicklow Capital and $5,000 from K&J Builders. </p><p>But the challenger has also taken nearly $60,000 alone from those involved with 150 N. Riverside, a property along the riverfront which saw its last appeal to the assessor’s office shut down in 2018 — the year Kaegi took office. David Carlins, CEO of Magellan Development, a luxury rental and condo developer who has worked on projects such as the St. Regis skyscraper, also dropped $40,000 on Hynes’ campaign.</p><p>“We have a very wide swath of support for the campaign, including those active in the real estate market,” Hynes said.</p><div class="RichTextSidebarModule Enhancement" data-module data-align-center><a class="AnchorLink" id="module-3a0000" name="module-3a0000"></a> <div class="RichTextModule-items RichTextBody"><h3>Illinois 2026 primary election schedule</h3><br><b>Feb. 5</b>: Early voting and vote by mail begins<br><br><b>March 1</b>: Online voter registration ends, but voters may register in person at <a class="Link" href="https://www.elections.il.gov/VotingAndRegistrationSystems/EarlyVotingLocationsSearch.aspx" target="_blank" >election authority and early voting sites</a><br><br><b>March 12</b>: Deadline for online and posted applications to vote by mail; in-person requests for absentee ballots may be made through March 16<br><br><b>March 17</b>: Polls open for Primary Election Day from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m.<br><br><b>March 31</b>: Deadline to return absentee ballots postmarked on or before Primary Election Day</div> </div><p></p><p><a class="Link" href="https://www.chicagotribune.com/2024/08/04/cook-county-assessor-misclassifies-hundreds-of-properties/" target="_blank" ><u></u></a></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2025/01/17/senior-freeze-property-tax-exemption-fritz-kaegi-armando-saleh-cook-county-assessor-jill-fitzgerald" >City Hall lobbyist pays $96,000 for tax breaks Sun-Times showed he never should have been given</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2024/11/15/senior-freeze-property-tax-fritz-kaegi-cook-county-assessor" >Fritz Kaegi OK’d tax breaks for ‘low-income’ seniors, now demands proof they qualify amid Sun-Times probe</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/2022/7/8/23199200/property-tax-breaks-exemptions-errors-cook-county-assessor-fritz-kaegi-barbara-kaplan-israel-martin" >Pay up, Cook County orders homeowners after Sun-Times exposed wrongful property tax breaks</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2025/05/23/fritz-kaegi-cook-county-assessor-wrongful-tax-breaks-erroneous-exemptions-walter-burnett" >Cook County assessor gave $930,000 in wrongful tax breaks, then waived penalties, interest over its errors</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p></p><p></p>
entries.author: Violet Miller

entries.title: Margaret Bonds, an influential Chicago composer, gets a gravestone, at last
entries.summary: <p>Composer and pianist Margaret Bonds was a trailblazer. In 1933, she became the first Black musician to solo with the Chicago Symphony. She composed spiritual arrangements that became favorites of the superstar opera singer Leontyne Price, and had her music performed on prime-time television and by major American orchestras.</p><div
